intro: Stemmadenia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian stemmadenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four or five petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
